org.mitre.synthea.helpers

Class RandomCollection<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.mitre.synthea.helpers.RandomCollection<E>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class RandomCollection<E>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Random collection of objects, with weightings. Intended to be an equivalent to the ruby Pickup gem. Adapted from https://stackoverflow.com/a/6409791/630384
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • RandomCollection

        public RandomCollection()

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(double weight,
                E result)
        Add an object (result) to the collection with a given weight. If the weight is negative, the object (result) is not added to the collection. Objects are retrieved by weight using the next method.
        Parameters:
        weight - - Positive weight of the result.
        result - - the object to add to the collection.

      • next

        public E next(java.util.Random random)
        Select an item from the collection at random by the weight of the items. Selecting an item from one draw, does not remove the item from the collection for subsequent draws. In other words, an item can be selected repeatedly if the weights are severely imbalanced.
        Parameters:
        random - - Random object.
        Returns:
        a random item from the collection weighted by the item weights.

      • next

        public E next(RandomNumberGenerator random)
        Select an item from the collection at random by the weight of the items. Selecting an item from one draw, does not remove the item from the collection for subsequent draws. In other words, an item can be selected repeatedly if the weights are severely imbalanced.
        Parameters:
        random - the random number generator.
        Returns:
        a random item from the collection weighted by the item weights.
